intro: Phyteuma collinum, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and sturdy. Phyteuma collinum is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is often used in rock gardens or alpine settings.
